author: {'steamid': '76561197966524862', 'num_games_owned': 1737, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1602417044}
review:
Désolé en général je n'écris pas de critique négative mais là.

Le jeu est daté, graphiquement et en terme de gameplay, on est plutot sur un jeu des années 2010 (voir antérieur), rien de bien grave en soit, un gameplay a l'ancienne et des graphismes pas tres aguicheur peuvent malgré tout servir un bon jeu.

Ici c'est un peu compliqué, apres une intro qui prend son temps, un poil ennuyeuse, ou votre héro se reveil bourré dans un bar et qu'un dialogue mou du genoux definisse un peu sa personnalité de bagareur blasé alcoolo (une tentative de hardboiled mais loupé) voila qu'on rencontre la princesse, bon là j'en ai eu marre j'ai zappé le dialogue, dommage a priori c'est là qu'on apprend VRAIMENT l'histoire, les 5 (ou 10 ?) premieres minutes étant juste le blabla entre le héro et le barman. Petit soucis de rythme, c'est pas grave on va pas crucifié le jeu pour si peu.

Me voila ensuite dans une grande ville, une sorte de cité sortie d'un Sky of Arcadia, un truc grand, vide, avec de l'animation inutile (comprendre des perso qui font des trucs en plein milieu, mais sans bruit, sans sound design, sans interaction possible) des rues et places grande et vide d'utilité, tres semblable a ce que j'ai trop souvent traversé dans les JRPG, du volume de vent juste pour donner l'impression que c'est une grande cité (alors que y a 3 pequenaud utile et une poignée de lieu avec interaction, tous evidemment disposé le plus loin possible les uns des autres). Niveau ambiance/design on est sur du Arcanum sauvagement agressé par du FF7, du steampunk emprunt d'influence plus asiatique, des machines trop grosse, des cape et des armure a plume et des ennemis qui sortent par des portails dimensionnel. Bref en terme de coherence d'ensemble j'ai rapidement oublié l'élégance et le charme désuet et coquet d'Arcanum pour la grandiloquence et l'excentricité propre a certains JRPG.

Le perso se déplace avec une camera semi-fixe, un peu a la Resident Evil, sur un rail ou au moins une zone d'influence, mais elle suivra toujours le personnage en faisant face a une direction général donné, pas de liberté de tourner la camera comme on le souhaite, juste une petite amplitude pour regarder un peu les cotés. Pas folichon, mais pourquoi pas.

Niveau animation j'ai rarement vu un personnage courir d'une façon aussi "wut ?", entre la crise hemoroidaire aigue doublé d'une diahrée explosive dangeureusement prete au départ et un primate tentant une pose de male alpha. Bon en vrai c'est pas si horrible hein, c'est juste qu'il a la course/démarche la plus étrange que j'ai vu depuis des années. Le truc c'est que je comprend pas comment on peut se foiré a se point là, dans un "Blue Stinger" (vieux jeu dreamcast) le perso a un déplacement tres mal animé, il a clairement un balais dans le cul, tout est tres rigide, mais là le perso a une animation un peu "complete" mais la posture est beaucoup trop étrange.

Reste que la ville est chiante a pleuré, apres avoir passé 20min a chercher quoi y faire dans de multiple écran aux passant discutant dans un silence de mort, j'ai fini par lire les livres de la bibliotheque, 36 écran avec une bonne dose de texte qui débloque un achievement ET qui donne les clefs pour comprendre le lore du jeu. Désolé aux auteurs, j'ai rien lu, j'ai déjà subi 7 min d'intro pour un héro qui blatte avec un barman des propos ininteressant et insipide ne m'offrant aucune indication sur l'univers et l'histoire, c'est con vous auriez coller un peu de vos info utile dans ce dialogue ça m'aurait déjà fourni une premiere approche. La je suis en mode faineant et j'esperais comprendre et découvrir plus lors d'un prochain dialogue/cut-scene.

Ensuite je me re-balade en ville, je fais coin et recoins et je tombe ENFIN sur la suite du niveau, qui m'envoi quelque part (une foret, au dessus de la gare d'ou je sors) et le pas mal commence. Des combat bourrin, des trucs bien de boeuf, de la balade en foret bucolique (et digne de 2006) et du cassage de monstre. Rien d'extraordinaire mais là y a eu un peu de gameplay sympatoche. Puis j'avance encore, c'est tres lineaire, pas tres beau, y a pas grand chose. J'active un event qui me fait passer du "jour a la nuit" (ou un truc dans le genre, je crois que c'est une dimension parallele magique) et j'ai une autre entité de mon personnage, plus sauvage, avec des "pouvoirs", il tape pas vraiment les ennemis mais se defend comme il peut. Par contre lui peu sauter, et me voila sur un tout petit peu de passage plateforme, avec des sauts long, simple, le perso semble défié un peu la gravité et être assez agile, même si les controles sont correct/daté. 

Et puis pouf, j'arrive dans une grotte, je dézingue des gars et puis je bloque, je suis descendu dans ce trou, je ne peux pas revenir en arriere, il n'y a rien autour de moi hormis une sorte de "serrure/enigme" avec des glyphes, rien d'indiqué, je tourne 2/3 min et... bin non je vais pas forcer plus.

Le jeu n'est pas catastrophique, il est juste vraiment daté et médiocre et surtout il n'est absolument pas fini. Il manque des FX et des feedback lors de certains combat (les mouches qui nous attaque et explose, on a bien les degats et la "projection" du personnage due a une explosion, mais la mouche elle a juste "disparu" sans laissé ni trace ni FX), l'interface est au fraise, avec une carte plutot inutile, un "journal de quete" constitué juste de plusieurs bloc avec des indications assez décousu, un écran presentant les armes mais ça semble vraiment pas être un inventaire (tellement l'impression que c'est une image fixe, d'ailleurs en "changeant" de personnage dans le mode jour/nuit ça n'a rien changé a son "équipement" alors qu'il n'a plu ni lame ni flingue).

Bref le jeu semble dans un stade alpha, avec un gros manque de finition, c'est jouable, mais le gameplay en lui même oscille entre le médiocre chiant et le passable correct, la narration ne m'a pas convaincu et... bin globalement l'effort pour en retiré du divertissement, de l'interet, du plaisir ne m'a vraiment pas semblé bon a fournir. 

C'est pas une catastrophe ni un jeu extremement mauvais, c'est juste un jeu ambitieux, un peu mal foutu et malheureusement trop mal fini pour que je puisse trouver un quelconque interet a m'infliger ses défauts. Donc au premier blocage un peu absurde et apres seulement 47min de jeu, j'ai décidé de laisser tomber.

En général je ne note jamais les jeux sans les avoir fini (ou tres tres largement avancé) mais ici c'est un peu obligé, le jeu n'est pas cher mais a moins d'être totalement a fond sur les vieux JRP action des années 2000/2010 et encaisser sans mal les interfaces inutiles, des controles "passable" et une finition aux abonnés absente. Je ne peux que déconseiller se jeu :-/

Je souhaite cependant aux developpeurs de trouver le temps peut être un jour, de poster un patch pour polish un peu leur jeu. Je pense qu'ils y ont passé du temps, qu'ils avaient de bonne intention et des ambitions, mais qu'un manque de moyen les a rattrapé. Ça ne rendrait pas le jeu bon, mais ça le rendrait au moins jouable a un plus grand nombre, en l'état y a vraiment trop de truc manquant ou mal foutu pour passer outre.

review:
Ne vous fiez pas à mon temps de jeu. Je l'ai laissé tourner et oublié quelques heures après avoir constaté que les contrôles au clavier étaient exécrables.
Impossible de déplacer la caméra à l'aide de la souris, tout juste un petit décalage de la vue, mais tout se fait au clavier : WASD pour se déplacer, et IJKL pour décaler très légèrement la vue, mais pas de réelle liberté. Impossible de reconfigurer les touches. C'est une fois ce constat effectué que j'ai laissé le jeu tourner pour récupérer ses cartes, sans volonté d'y rejouer.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2005151465

Je lui ai pourtant laissé une seconde chance, en tentant de jouer à la manette... C'est du coup déjà plus simple que de passer son clavier en QWERTY et se déplacer avec WASD.
La caméra suit notre personnage, en vue à la 3ème personne, et le décalage de vue de quelques centimètres se fait avec le 2nd stick directionnel... C'est un peu plus maniable qu'au clavier, mais toujours aussi frustrant de ne pas avoir la possibilité de diriger librement la caméra, une caméra qui peut changer brutalement de position, ce qui est parfois vraiment déconcertant. Un ennemi peut du coup de se retrouver facilement hors du champ de vue et la situation devient insupportable.
C'est ainsi que j'ai abandonné une seconde fois ce jeu...

Au final, j'ai probablement joué environ 1 heure. C'est regrettable, car je sentais que l'univers steampunk, bien que visuellement un peu vieillot, pouvait me plaire. J'aurais pu accrocher à ce jeu. Il aurait suffit de pouvoir orienter la caméra à l'aide de la souris et reconfigurer les touches clavier pour que je prolonge l'expérience.

[b]En l'état, non, [i]Edge of Twilight[/i] est trop injouable et le jeu laisse une sensation d'inachevé. Dommage, il y avait du potentiel, et ça se joue à peu de choses.[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561197977374365', 'num_games_owned': 54, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1559920964}
review:
Finger weg von diesem Spiel!!! es ist völlig verbuggt, Glitches und Animationsfreezes ohne Ende. Der Bossfight gegen den Riesenaffen ist aufgrund dieser Fehler nicht oder so gut wie nicht gewinnbar. Dazu noch eine nicht-konfigurierbare, völlig unlogische und komplizierte Steuerung und die Kamera ist ein absoluter Graus (springt ständig hin- und her ohne Sinn und Verstand und tötet damit die Übersicht (v.a. in den Bossfights) komplett. Die stimmige Steam-Punk-Welt ist ja ganz hübsch und auch die Story ist recht vielsagend inszeniert, allerdings nützt das nichts, wenn so gut wie nichts erklärt wird und auch nicht klar wird, warum wir etwas tun sollen. Dazu kommt noch eine gruselige Übersetzung ins Deutsche, die oft unfreiwillig komisch wirkt. Zudem sieht es so aus, als ob sich der Entwickler schon lange von dem Projekt verabschiedet hat, der letzte Eintrag im Forum stamm von Ende 2018. Somit ist auch an Patches, die die gröbsten Fehler ausmerzen könnten nicht mehr zu denken
Ne, ne lieber Entwickler, das war wohl nichts. Wird umgehend wieder deinstalliert, bevor ich meinen Controller aus lauter Frust an die Wand pfeffere!

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11208, 'playtime_forever': 585, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 585, 'last_played': 1535108655}
review:
This is a third person action/adventure/RPG kind of game where you control some guy in some steampunk fantasy land solving a big quest, or something.  I skipped most of the storyline because it seems like it's half an hour to get into the game (the developer forces you to go through the whole set of credits before starting, which should be a red flag). 

The game itself is very badly polished for a 2016 game, although apparently it was in development hell for years.  The game is a console port that apparently didn't meet the console release, and is also apparently incomplete.   I didn't get far enough to find out, because the camera controls are completely terrible, some of the worst I have ever seen.  The fixed camera angles alone are enough to avoid this game.   The graphics are high poly and high quality textures (good) but there's a filter you can't remove, and terrible lack of shadows making the game look like DooM with the gamma turned up in every room (very bad).

Can't recommend, $15 is way too much for a game abandoned by developers after a "MVP" dump and run.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971006744', 'num_games_owned': 3873, 'num_reviews': 170, 'playtime_forever': 199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1634869032}
review:
Muy mal este Edge of Twilight, una pena la verdad, tenemos un beatemup en un mundo steampunk con unos escenarios muy bien logrados, el sistema de combate no inventa nada pero es vistoso, rápido y satisfactorio, las ejecuciones y  los acercamientos de cámara en las peleas 1 contra 1 están muy bien y el rollo de los dos mundos llevando a "dos" personajes con sus ataques y sus habilidades llama la atención y hace que los puzzles ganen algo mas de interés. Por desgracia eso es todo, la historia no termina de enganchar aunque el mundo en la que se desenvuelve llame mucho la atención, los gráficos son malillos, las texturas son horribles, los efectos, los npcs, las animaciones y las hitboxes son para llorar, bugs por doquier,caida de fps random, glitchs, poping e incluso algunos bugs, todo acompañado de un plataformeo bastante mejorable, una camara horripilante que va en contra del jugador, planos innecesarios, algunos escenarios son enormes y estan completamente vacios y lleno de muros invisibles, a la hora del combate no se nota impacto en los ataques, las hitboxes no ayudan nada a la hora de bloquear o esquivar, algunas animaciones tampoco acompañan bien y la camara seguirá haciendo de las suyas...

En conclusión y sin haber jugado mucho en principio no lo recomiendo. Creo que le queda mucho por optimizar y arreglar cientos de errores que padece y que se ven a legüas ya desde la intro. Los gráficos son pasables, el mundo que nos propone es precioso e interesante, el combate no está del todo mal, y el rollo de los reinos también le da un toque, pero todo eso junto no consigue equilibrar ni mucho menos superar todos los defectos que tiene. Por desgracia este es un género que no se ve mucho en steam, y si te encanta el rollo steampunk o el género... puedes darle una oportunidad, pero dudo que lo acabes.

review:
Edge of Twilight – Return To Glory could have been something special, but it fails miserably. The game was in development hell for a decade before final release and it shows. The Steampunk/Dieselpunk world looks amazing for a game that would have been released 8-10 years ago, the character models are nicely done, the story is good and the overall premise is great. The lore of the game is in fact intriguing, especially if you visit the library in the beginning. You can tell that a lot of effort was put into the details by the developers. The books give a good insight on the enemies you will encounter later as well as providing more knowledge about the world.                                                                     
                                                                                                                                                                                              
Where Edge of Twilight falls short is what makes a game enjoyable, gameplay mechanics. The main character, Lex, moves like a slug unless he is his alter ego in the "night world", controls are clunky and the gun in the game feels extremely weak. Melee fighting isn't so bad and is probably the best part of the gameplay. All of these things could be overlooked, but the horrible camera put the nail in the coffin. I have never played a game with such a terrible camera! The sluggish movements and bad camera really became an issue during the first boss fight. I beat Jiankra in under 10 minutes, but that was enough for me, the terrible camera made my head hurt and I let it idle for cards. 		                                                				
                                                                                                                                                                                                   
The developers plan for this to be an episodic game. Supposedly there is going to another episode, in another 10 years maybe? There's a $14 price tag on the Ultimate Collector's Edition for a promise of another episode from a company that took a decade to release a subpar game. I don't think so, no thanks.							           
                                                                                                                                                                                                   
For $14.99, all episodes should be included especially since the base game is worth about $5. Odds are that the next episode will never see the light of day and the people who bought the Ultimate Collector's Edition DLC have been ripped-off. Thankfully, I was able to get this in a cheap bundle. 										                    
                                                                                                                                                                                                    
It's really too bad that the developers, who obviously had a passion for their game, haven't made any effort to correct the issues that plague Edge of Twilight. With a little polish and some tweeks here and there it could be an awesome game, but alas it is what it is. Not recommended.

review:
This is garbage, but it is garbage with loads of ambition and overachieving. 

It coagulates echoes of Beyond Good and Evil, the Prince Of Persia 2003 reboots, and Legacy of Kain Soul Reaver in its mechanics.  But well, it's completely wrong, movement and controls are weird in whatever form you take. Non-combat areas are awkward to navigate, combat feels like too much work to be satisfying. Don't even talk to me about camera controls. The graphical artifacts are like a Gamecube game upscaled through an emulator. Was this once imagined as a Gamecube game? It makes sense if so, it certainly feels like something from 13 years ago (or at least paying homage to that era) instead of the 8 year gestation period.

Someday a rich fool will throw plenty of money at these devs to remaster this to measure up to their grand vision. Maybe It'll look and even feel like a game from 2016. Until that happens, there's a lot to overcome to love this mutant.

author: {'steamid': '76561198275968358', 'num_games_owned': 5836, 'num_reviews': 141, 'playtime_forever': 377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 377, 'last_played': 1487429747}
review:
Şimdiye kadar birçok ön inceleme makalesi yazdım, genelde bu yazılarımı kısa tutmaya çalışsam da tutamadım. Ne yapayım kısa yazmak içime sinmiyor daha çok bilgi ve öneri vermek pahasına bazen ipin ucunu kaçırdığım olmuştur. Toplum olarak çok okumaya meyilli olmadığımızı da çok iyi biliyorum. Çok uzun makaleler filan gördüğümüzde çoğumuz sıkılıp okumaktan çekiniriz. Genelde Ooo destan yazmış bu yazı okunur mu? Gibi söylemlerde bulunuyoruz. Aslında yaptığım tam incelemelerde de bazı oyunlarda çok uzattığım ve sıktığım olmuştur ama bunu ön incelemelere yansıtmamaya özenle çalıştım. Bundan sonra da elimden geldiğince ön incelemelerimi ve tam incelemelerimi kısa ve öz şekilde yazmaya çalışacağım.

Bugün ön incelemesini yapacağım oyun benim çok önemsediğim, bağımsız bir stüdyo oyunu olan ve fantastik bir aksiyon, macera karışımı Edge of Twilight: Return to Glory. Oyunumuz için hemen sizlere bir benzetme yaparak başlayacağım, böylece oyuna dair bilgileri daha çabuk kavrayabilesiniz. Edge of Twilight Castlevania Lords of Shadow ve God of War benzeri bir oyun diyebiliriz. Kamera açılarından tutunda gotik mekânlarına, karşınıza çıkan ilginç yaratıklardan mistik hikâyesine kadar birçok benzerlik mevcut. Yönettiğimiz savaşçı o gizemli ve gotik birçok yapının bulunduğu yerden o yeri yöneten kraliçe tarafından çağırılır ve ona bir tek onun başarabileceği düşünülen bir görev verilir. Yönettiğimiz karakterimiz istemeye istemeye de olsa bu görevi kabul eder. Daha sonra bu garip gotik mekânlarda elimizi kolumuzu sallaya sallaya gezebiliyoruz.

 İnsanlarla diyaloglara filan giremiyoruz. Bize verilen görevleri haritadan bularak yerine getirmeliyiz. Şehirde iken silah kullanıp saldırı yapamıyoruz. Ama görevlere girdiğimizde karakterimizin sırtında taşıdığı tuhaf silahını kullanabiliyoruz. Bize saldıran yaratıkları biraz orklara benzettim garip sesler çıkartıp size deliler gibi saldırıyorlar. Sizlerde onlara değişik kombolar yaparak karşılık verebilirsiniz. Ama hep saldırmayın zira sizi bayağı zorladıkları içim koruma da yapın derim. Özel saldırı filan var mı bilmiyorum. Bir de karakterimizin içinde olan gücü müdür nedir artık anlamadığım değişik bir yaratık gibi yönetebildiğimiz hızlı ve ellerini pençe olarak kullanabilen bir savaşçıyı yönetebiliyoruz. Oyunu gamepad ile oynayabilirsiniz arkadaşlar. Ne yazık ki oyunun Türkçe dil desteği yok, ama ileri de yaması çıkabilir. Yaptığım ön inceleme itibari ile bu oyunla alakalı sizlere aktaracaklarım şimdilik bu kadar arkadaşlar, ileri de oyunu bitirdikten sonra detaylı bir şekilde kritiğini yaparız. Hepinize iyi oyunlar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198167772276', 'num_games_owned': 5521, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1495010812}
review:
The game in its current state is nowhere near finished. It feels and plays like a bad PS2 port in alpha state. Although Edge of Twilight has potential and the steampunk setting is somewhat original I have my doubts that the devs can and will invest the time,work and money it takes to polish it. 
Levels are extremely linear with boss fights being unnecessarly difficult because of laggy movement controls and an abysmal camera. Some of the checkpoints are badly placed forcing you to do the same silly run to the next fight again if you die.
I got the game out of nostalgia and I don't regret buying it but I can't recommend the game to anyone unaware of the game's sad development history. If you look at the achievement stats you can clearly see that something is wrong as most achievements are in the under one percent range showing me that the majority didn't bother to play it for a longer period of time.
The technical side of things looks brighter I could play the game in 4K with constant 50+ fps. The textures look awful and washed out even with HDR on and forcing 8xMSAA and 16xAF through the driver. I play with an i7 4790K@4.4 GHz, MSI R9 390X, 16GB RAM, Win10_64 Pro, Radeon Crimson 16.12.2 driver.
The price of the game is way to high for what it delivers and asking another €14 for a follow up episode which may or may not be released is ridiculous when the priority should be to fix the game as is. 
I give it a 5/10 for now asking you to wait how the game's development evolves before you decide to buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021884891', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 411, 'last_played': 1485593973}
review:
I'm not even sure how I came to own this game, but I recommend you stay away. It took setting compatibility mode to Windows 7 and running the game as an admin just to get it to not crash instantly. 

The game contains dated graphics, terrible dialogue audio that was probably recorded on a cell phone while standing in a bathroom, and questionable controls. 

This is apparently an episodic game series, even though I can't seem to find anything saying such on the store page. You play as a young man with serious back issues that affect his ability to stand and walk properly. He carries a magical steam-punk gun-sword that causes enemies to T-Pose upon death, making them easy to loot. There are also plenty of long unskippable dialogue sections that can't be sped up, giving you plenty of time to catch up on reading or go to the bathroom.

Really though, stay away. The asking price for this game (again, Chapter One of a series) is ludicrous for what you get.

Animation is like from the 90s, strange camera, blurry textures. Voice-over feels too... Overacted, I guess. As the whole beginning is, even though it's being presented as if "normal day". Steampunk elements seem illogical at times. I mean, too illogical. Also, why does Lex crouches almost all the time? The way you are introduced to the story is bad, as well: you are thrown into it, but since it lacks proper dynamic (which should be present in such cases), it makes you feel bored, instead of excited. Even Rise Of Tomb Raider threw you in along with good dynamic and it felt right and all. Here it does not. The temp suggests that it should have been a more gradual introduction to the characters and the world, and it then would have been more realistic to present the main story as "beginning of another job".
All in all, I'd really love to see a good steampunk game, but this is just not it. Not for me.

review:
[h1]Это не игра это личинка игры.[/h1]
[b]Сюжет: [/b] он как бы есть и вроде бы интересный, но в игре его нет, а точнее это стартовая кат сцена и ВСЕ. Кат сцена в конце, да и сама концовка полный бред, ничего не объясняет, ни на что не влияет. 

[b]Вселенная: [/b] Да кстати в игре есть зачатки игрового мира. Если не полениться и все-таки сходить в библиотеку, то там обнаружите множество записей описывающих вселенную игры. Они интересны и даже вдохновляющие, но тоже ни на что не влияют. Ничего из описанного вам в процессе игры не понадобиться.

[b]Графика и звук: [/b] графика на уровне PS2 но игру это не портит, скорее придает стиля. Музыка в игре есть и даже неплохая но ее мало.

[b]Геймплей: [/b]
[list]
    [*]жирный минус за камеру - если уж сделали ее неуправляемой(кинематографической) то потрудитесь хорошо ее запрограммировать. У меня часто выходило так что во время боя камера просто улетала в сторону, или во время движения была направлена на меня а не в сторону движения, от чего возникает ощущение что бежишь задом наперед.
    [*]В игре много не очевидных путей, при отвратительной камере и отсутствии карты заблудиться в трех соснах сам бог велел. А битва с финальным боссом это просто взрыв мозга. [spoiler]Серьёзно почему горилла, в сюжете вообще нет ни единого намёка на гориллу. Босс вертолёт для вас слишком банально. [/spoiler]
    [*]В игре всего 3 вида врагов 2 босса.
[/list]

[i]Заключение: это техно-демо но никак не игра. Выглядит как фарш из сюжета на салфетке и набора клише из старых слешеров. [/i]
Игра не стоит [strike]свеч[/strike] денег, но если по скидке то можно ознакомиться.

review:
配樂+
場景美術+
全中文介面和字幕+
關卡設計+
每個角色的塑造都很完整，場景的風景很美，城內的幾個特別鏡頭的NPC身上配件非常有趣，蒸汽龐克風的細節做的還是蠻用心的。
配樂很好聽，跟畫面和事件都有搭配上，遊戲一開始提示說可以圖書館看一看，的確是蠻推薦的，擁有很完整的世界觀和怪物介紹，很難想像這是獨立製作的遊戲，最重要的是圖書館的書籍內容居然都翻譯成中文了，不是機翻，這一點就大推。
鍵盤和搖桿的操控都很順手，戰鬥的氛圍不錯，配樂ㄧ出來就加分。跟客服反應過遇到的小bug，下一個版本就修復了，反應速度很快有點驚訝wwwww 因為是獨立遊戲吧，看得出對玩家的回覆很用心。
還有些地方可以再更好，期待開發者繼續更新，的確是很有潛力的遊戲。

author: {'steamid': '76561198010842921', 'num_games_owned': 871, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 600, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1500761342}
review:
Итак, Edge of Twilight. Я ждал эту игру как только увидел ее трейлер "Someone special" в 2008 году, меня заворожила ее мрачная атмосфера, вселенная, стилистика и музыка и красивая графика. За годы производства игры графика, понятное дело, успела немного устареть, однако сам визуальный ряд и стилистика осталась на прежнем уровне (хотя, как на мой взгляд, картинка в ранних геймплейных скриншотах, видео и трейлерах смотрелась немного эффектнее. Возможно дело в эффектах постпроцесса консольных версий. На AG.ru можно найти старые скриншоты и видео и сравнить). Немного изменился общий цветовой тон игры, она стала более яркой, а также изменился дизайн дневной версии главного героя (что меня немного огорчило), возможно, это как-то должно быть связано с сюжетом, но старый Лекс мне нравился больше, новому герою не хватает, мне кажется, плаща. В игре присутствует превосходная музыка, автор которой сам Mick Gordon, она отлично вписывается и дополняет атмосферу.  Боевая составляющая весьма занимательна - дневной Лекс вооружён чем-то вроде меча, совмещенного с подобием шотгана, которыми он зрелищно орудует, очень эффектно смотрится, когда камера наезжает и крупным планом показывает как Лекс атакует противника, есть брутальные добивания, но не всегда понятно как их задействовать. А вот чем вооружен ночной Лекс не очень понятно и не сразу понимаешь как им сражаться вообще, за него геймплей больше представляет весьма интересный и простой платформер. Также в игре есть головоломки, в которых нужно задействовать обоих персонажей – и дневного и ночного Лекса. Очень порадовало наличие в игре русского языка – конечно, не обошлось без мелких ошибок, но в целом перевод выполнен неплохо. 
Несмотря на то, что игра находилась столько лет в разработке она выглядит и играется как будто бы ее где-то не успели недоделать. Анимация героев в некоторых роликах очень неубедительная даже для 2008 года, часто встречаются баги. Например иногда враги перестают получать урон и вообще никак не реагируют на атаки, зато Лекс от них огребает по полной, из-за чего часто необходимо по много раз перепроходить один и тот же участок уровня (благо, чекпоинтов расставлено достаточно). Не всегда понятно как сражаться с крупными противниками и от чего именно ты умираешь при сражении с ними. 
Очень хотелось бы чтобы во время всех сражений звучала музыка, ее очень не хватает. 

В целом я рекомендую ознакомиться с Edge of Twilight, это очень атмосферная и интересная игра с достойным сюжетом и вселенной. Стоит она недорого, особенно при том, что сейчас в этом жанре затишье да и вообще игр с подобной стилистикой крайне мало. Несмотря на столь долгий период разработки Edge of Twilight по прежнему остается уникальной игрой. 


Надеюсь, разработчики поправят недочеты в одном из патчей в будущем.

The game is rough around the edges no one can deny that, considering it went through development hell it's just about a miracle this game ever got out. There are bugs and the textures are a bit dated, but I would wholely reccommend this game based on the developers dedication to it.

They are putting out patches quickly, addressing bugs and communicating with steam users through the steam forums. These guys work hard and have a big dedication to this game. I recieved my copy of edge of twilight via their indiegogo funding run. When they didn't reach the goal they refunded all of our money and gave everyone who pledged a free copy upon release. From that point on I have seen the developers being active, helpful, and bugfixing. I happily puchased the collectors edition to show them additional support.

This game will continue to improve, and while it's launch has been rougher than any of us would want it shows great promise to be polished into something great.

author: {'steamid': '76561198334220081', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 422, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1563012265}
review:
I am a developer in Japan. But I generally don't play PC games. Its just troublesome. 
However, I have been following Edge of Twilight for years, and it seem not coming out on consoles anymore. So I decide to give it a try on PC. It is not a pleasant experience to get the game running on my work PC, and there is a serious bug preventing me to launch the game properly.

Anyway, while trying to get the game running, I have been reading all the reviews, and seeing all the criticism about the graphics. After I play the game for a few hours, I want to add my opinion about the graphics.

The graphics are certainly not something fancy. But it is beautiful. It's more like looking at a piece of art. The presentation is really good. And I am really surprised to see an Indie developer was able to pull this off. I don't think you should compare this game with some recently released big titles. It is like comparing "Vase with Twelve Sunflowers" from Van Gogh and "Bleach" from Tite Kubo. They are very different style. Please excuse my over exaggerated comparison, I do not mean this game is anywhere as good as Van Gogh. I am only trying to express that we should see it differently. Haven't we seen enough similar games already?

However, there are many game play issues. Most will be picked up by a publisher and QA team. I understand that the costs involved are significant to the indie developer. This problem greatly degrades the fun factor of the game. I wish the developer can quickly fix those problems. Most issues have already been mentioned by many other reviewers here, so there is no reason to repeat them again here.

I can see the huge potential of this title, and those future updates to come. And I have to say, despite many bugs, I actually had allot of fun. So my verdict is, you may want to give a try of this little gem. It fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123929626', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 547, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 547, 'last_played': 1475428183}
review:
Greetings,

i have never wrote a negative review for a game, i love most games and even some known to be not so good i can find enjoyment with most. However, there are two reasons for this negative review and they are very  strong unfortunately. First, i'm afraid this game feels like a scam of some sort. I saw it and liked what i saw, i felt the price was adequate for it and it was in promotion so i bought it. Big mistake. The game is full of gliches and bugs that severely hinder gameplay to the point of making it broken. I tried my best to overlook those and just focus on what i liked and the reason i bought it in the first place. Steampunk world and story. However after struggling against all the game breaking obstacles i was faced with (this is the reason i seem to have that many hours of play, in reality, it was mostly reloading and trying to overcome the bugs and gliches in truth there is not much of game content here to justify the time i have spent with it) i reach a point in the game that shows me i have an incomplete game!!

 I went back to the steam page and what i find is the developer saying that this is only part of the game and the rest of the game will unlock if we buy the ultimate super collectors edition... 

What is this? I was shocked! There was nothing warning me about anything like this on the steam page for the game! Is this the state we're in now?! Shady tactics to force consumers to pay for a game twice?!! One for a demo and then a second one for the real game?!! A paywall for a broken mess of a game at that!  No, i wont do that for any game.
 
Now i have noticed the developer added a comment about it on the steam page claiming it's going to be an episodic game but that wasn't there when i first bought it. It was added because some users commented that he, the developer, could get in trouble if he did not warn people properly. I wasn't warned, i wasn't informed. It was concealed from me at the time of buying, I want a refund because i would not have bought this game had i known it would be sold in such terms.

review:
Игра оставляет двоякие ощущения:
+ цена, своих денег игра действительно стоит (нельзя сравнивать игры за 2000 и  300р)
+ видна работа грамотных дизайнеров - графика хоть и устарела, но  дизайн уровней на высоте
+ достаточно интересный сюжет и мир
- игра морально устарела как в плане графики, так и игровой механики - такие игры выходили 10 лет назад 
- скучная боевка - по сути у нас 3 удара, блок и перекат, после Darksiders играть не интересно
- кривая камера которой нельзя управлять
- статичные nps + отствуствие второстепенных заданий
- отсуствие карты - я минут 15 бегал по начальному городу в поисках вокзала

В итоге: если Вам раньше нравились подобные игры, то в Edge of Twilight Вам определенно стоит сыграть, всем остальным лучше игру не брать - есть проекты посвежее и поинтереснее.

review:
游戏是当时在indiegogo时赞助购买的，本来是好奇，因为我平时不用Steam玩游戏，可是后来他们主动退款给我还给我免费序号说谢谢我愿意支持。尼玛我当时就震惊了！
游戏刚下好运行有问题，因为以前玩很多别的游戏也出现过这种情况所以我猜是360挡住了，果然跟客服联系后，删掉360后又把搜狗输入法换成英文输入法就能玩了，因为简中好像看评论说有点问题所以我用英文玩的，然后就没有其他问题了。
蒸汽朋克风我还是很喜欢的，用摇杆操作也没有问题，主角换成夜晚状态时的场景很厉害，夜晚模式的战斗初次打不太上手，但熟了后还挺有趣的，尤其是爆血有一种爽快感。
推荐喜欢这种风格的玩家来试试，等中文修复好就可以继续玩了应该，对剧情接下来进展还是挺感兴趣的。

review:
Edge of Twilight- Return to glory, in many ways, reminds me of myself, because it is so full of potential. And the execution, while not terrible was a bit- just a bit, rushed.

You take the role of a 'hybrid'..an outcaste, who has some special abilities, is a bit of an witty ansewhole with a goldden heart etc etc, your usual video game plot.

The game world itself is imagined and designed well.

Having said that, I cannnot say that it isn't enjoyable. It is an enjoyable experience in some ways and the game needs improvement and polish in some other criterias.


It is a third person action game with hack and slash combat, minor puzzle and very minor platforming.



[h1]The gameplay[/h1]-

Very enjoyable, hack and slash, 'cinematic', fluid. Only con is that the camera angles are fixed. The 'world' is split into separate realms of night and day.


[h1]The music[/h1]-

One of the major pros of the game is music. It goes with the steampunk-victorian setting and is actually pretty good, enjoyable.


[h1]The voice acting[/h1]-

Again a pro, good voice acting conveying the feelings of the characters, but the movements of the character models sometimes don't go with the voice.


[h1]The story[/h1]-

A bit of lore, an average story.



Now for the cons, there are many-

Characters movements, facial expressions deep in the uncanny valley
Random bugs, like getting stuck on ladders and all
Some crashes on frist tiem starting the game
The world seems a bit lifeless (to me), it requires a bit more vibrancy


[b][u]What I want to say is that this is the dev's (fuzzyeye) first release on steam and sure, they made some mistakes, but they have been constantly putting out updates, been active on the forums, taking any advice and replying to each and every inquiry by customers as well as potential customers, kudos to them for that.[/u]



All in all, it is a promising title, available on a good sale at release. Some might want to wait out until the bugs are fixed, some would get it at the moment....right now, it just makes the cut (JUST) worth the price.


Verdict- You can do two things-
 get it right now and watch the game develop as it does
 Wait until they fix the bugs, polish it more and again when it goes on sale


[h1][u][b]Caveat emptor- This purchase is just the first chapter of the game, for the rest of the story (ie full experience) you have to buy the Ultimate Collector's edition[/h1]

review:
Before I begin, I'd like to say that I was one of those people who had been waiting for this game ever since it's amazing "Someone Special" trailer had blown our minds in 2009.  So, after all these years of waiting patiently, after all the vaporware rumors and the problems that befell the original developers, (the game switched hands at some point, but kept the original team as well) it is finally out. Was it worth the wait? This is a tough question to answer, so I will just state the things I did like, and those I did not. I'll start with the positive aspects.
   
First of all, the setting is amazing. It falls in the category of what is know as "steampunk," a science fantasy setting, featuring technology and aesthetics that are heavily influenced by 19th century industrial steam powered machines. Edge of Twilight takes place in such a world, called Hellayem, a world where for some as of yet unclear reason, the realms of day and night have been seperated from one another, divided by a Rift. The world is populated by  two warring races, the Atherns and the Lithern, the first living in the realm of day, while the second ruling over the world of night, who are at constant odds over a resource called Ether.The game begins in the city of Athyr, a sprawling, mechanized placed filled with nobles, vagrands and everything between. Athyr is quite imposing, the steampunk elements visibly evident in its creation. From the steam powered, large city gates, trains and houses, to the weird, mechanical apparel and attire that its citizens are clothed in, the city is a prime example of steampunk done right, conveing a strangely alluring, immersing atmosphere as it invites you to explore every nook and cranny. The world's history and lore is quite deep and impressive and, if you are a bookworm like me, there is an in-game library in the city, where you can read on everything related to Hellayem, from its flora and fauna, all the way to politics and social stratification. The writers really did an amazing job fleshing out their setting and breathing life into it.
   
Moving on, the story is quite interesting, as it should be since the game bases a lot of its appeal on it. We get into the old boots of Lex, a hardened mercenary who happens to be the only Athern/Lithern hybrid that exists in the world, a quality that makes him hated by most, but also allows him to travel between the two realms freely. Because of this ability, Lex is summoned by Galina, the Empress of Athyr, who tells him of her plan to destroy the Rift that keeps Day and Night apart, and restore balance in the tortured world of Hellayem. In order to do so, Lex will have to travel across Hellayem to find and destroy three strange machines, and also assassinate Lukasin, the leader of the Litherns. Uncertain of how these actions will fix everything, the mercenary reluctantly agrees to her request, and begins his long journey. The plot is quite engaging, populated by a variety of characters, none of whom you know if you can trust, as well as strange animals and monsters that you will need to overcome. As of now, only the first chapter has been released, so not much of the story is known yet. But, as a foundation, what we have so far is quite promising and, combined with the game's deep history and lore, could evolve into something amazing.
   
Now, for the music. Oh, the music. This is easily the best feature of this game. If you noticed, in my introduction I mentioned a trailer called "Someone Special." Go, see it and listen to the music that dresses it. That should be enough to give you more than a taste of what they have done with this game. It was composed from scratch, specifically for Edge of Twilight, and it is magnificent. There is something majestic, alluring and at the same time imposing about it, something I cannot explain. It is a perfect fit for the setting.
   
The platforming is so and so. The idea of Lex switching between Night and Day is similar to the mechanic in Soul Reaver. Day Lex is more brutal/combat oriented while Night Lex is more agile and does most of the jumping/climbing/acrobatics, similar to the Prince of Persia, or any other action adventure game featuring an athletic protagonist. The switching between realms to progress is an interesting mechanic that is used quite well in this game.
   
Finally, I really enjoyed the fighting in this game when it comes to Day Lex. I will explain this division between Day Lex and Night Lex combat a bit later. Day Lex utilizes a huge sword/cleaver to hack and slash at his enemies, as well as a shotgun/blunderbush to blow them away. The combat is fast and frantic, and every hit feels heavy and deadly which, in combination with the vast amounts of blood and gore, and also the brutal executions/finishing moves Day Lex perfoms on his enemies, gives you a sense of satisfaction and a feeling that you are a badass mercenary. They say it is better to play with a controller, but I played with a mouse and keyboard and had no problem whatsoever.
   Now, for the bad stuff.
   First of all, the graphics and animations look quite outdated. Surprisingly, they look worse than how the game looked in their 2009 trailer. Now, I am not one to actually pay much attention to that, prefering solid gameplay over fancy visuals, but they still leave a bad taste in your mouth, especialy if you imagine how amazingly beautiful the setting and characters would look like in modern graphics when, even with its current visuals, there are some spots that leave you breathless. The textures are uneven, with some places looking beautiful while others featuring low resolution skins and textures, sometimes within the same space, making the differences really stand out. The animations are a bit clunky too, but mostly on the citizens of Athyr. Lex and the enemies are not that bad. 
   Secondly, Night Lex combat. Oh boy, this is quite frustrating. While Day Lex plays like a meat machine when it comes to fighting, Night Lex just feels wrong for it. I can't even describe his attack pattern. It seems like he is using his hands to suck away ether/energy from the enemies until he freezes them, and then shatters them to bits. It might sound kind of cool, but it's not. It feels extremely out of place, and will probably irritate you. I think they should have just kept Night Lex for the platforming part of the game, or maybe made him into a stealthy character who would have set pieces where he would also have to avoid combat. As he is now, he is fun when it comes to platforming, but awful when it comes to fighting.
   Moving on, the game is glitchy. Now, I have not suffered from many of the things other's have mentioned, but there was an instance where I was jumping from platform to platform with Night Lex, only to suddenly have my surroundings dissapear, and fall to my death. Another was when I opened the game, and it just showed me a black screen while I could still hear the music behind it. I have also happened to just freeze in place, unable to move, and be forced to load the game.
   An additional, major problem is the camera. It is unable to follow the action adequately, at times forcing you to make blind jumps, or hiding the enemies.  
   Finally, I think the game is a bit pricey. I can understand that there are still chapters to come, and that it won't be so short in length when it is complete, but 15 bucks (12 if you get it with the discount) for the base game's first chapter seems a bit much. I think it should be around 8-9 tops for what it offers at the moment.
   So, after all this, is the game worth a look? To conclude, yes, I'd recommend Edge of Twilight. Despite its flaws, I found myself enjoying it. I loved the visceral Day Lex combat, I was immersed in the setting, I was enchanted by the music, I am intrigued by the story and, as far as technical problems go, the developers are patching it up quite fast. I am looking forward to playing the rest of this tale!

review:
Edge of Twilight – Return to Glory is classified as a third person action adventure game and developed by FUZZYEYES, a relatively new company. Edge is a unique game but it falls short in some departments making it a bit questionable.
Keep in mind, the game so far is only one episode, more will be produced in the future, so think of the game as a telltale episode rather than a full game right away. 

The game story starts with Lex, a half breed rejected by society getting a request from the queen to accomplish a dangerous mission. In case you wonder, the game does have a similarity to Witcher 3 in terms of the character who is also grumpy and makes sarcastic remarks quite often.

From the beginning, I had a couple of issues with the game. One of my issues early was freezes. During a cinematic, my screen froze three times. Luckily, I was able to fix it by pressing control+alt+del command and getting back in the game. I also experienced a low frame rate even from the main menu even though I use an I7 with an NVidia GeForce GTX 960M 4 GB and 16 GB of memory. The game was constantly at 13 FPS which can be quite an issue for an action game.
In terms of graphics, the game seems to be using an older engine similar to PlayStation 2 games, however they did manage to capture the steampunk feeling quite well. 

The lore of the game is quite interesting, especially if you visit the library in the beginning. There was a lot of effort put into the details and it gives a nice insight on the enemies you will encounter later as well as more information about the world.

The plot seems to be intriguing and refreshing. The queen is trying to restore the night and day system as well as the war between the industrial Atherns and the spiritual Lithern which hints to future moral dilemma in terms of decisions.  The night and day system is also a feature in terms of combat and areas. The combat system usually relies on regular strikes, heavy attacks, shooting with a gun in day while in the night system activated at specific location, you became a sort of vampire throwing magic. The combat itself did seem a bit clunky although I am not sure if it is due to the fps situation or combat itself being clunky.

Another issue I was not happy with was the camera. Unfortunately, you cannot free-turn the camera which can be frustrating if you want to observe the surroundings and was also an issue during combat when I could not see the enemy attacking me.

Overall, I would say that Edge of Twilight – Return to Glory is an interesting game with some flaws which might please some individuals while intimidating others. Do I recommend the game? If the developers will fix the bugs and polish the game a bit, I think it could be an interesting jewel.

review:
Un Steampunk Action-Adventure in terza persona con sistema di combattimento cinematic e con un gameplay nelle quali due fazioni si combattono a rappresentare uno scontro tra il giorno e la notte.
Annunciato con musiche a livello di studio professionale di registrazione, e con interfaccia e sottotitoli italiani.
Come inizio merita, l'intro a video e' ben fatta, da subito una trama, graficamente il progetto mostra subito i suoi anni, la fisica e' ben fatta, il sistema di combattimento e' interessante. 
Trovato subito all'inizio un bug che non memorizza l'immagine a schermo intero, ad ogni avvio lo devi impostare. 
E' singleplayer, non vi e' ne multi ne coop. 
Non e' facile e questo mi piace. 
Le ambientazioni sono molto variegate, si passa dalla citta, a sotterranei ad ambienti naturali.
Il combattimento si suddivide in 2 classi ben distinte, in cui il personaggio assume o il ruolo di potere del giorno o della notte, cambiando anche aspetto, in quello della notte diventa tipo un personaggio di avatar.
La parte audio e' veramente ben curata, crea atmosfera, qua va apprezzata con cuffie.
Supporto totale anche a gamepad, almeno il mio logitech funziona perfettamente.
Peccato per la grafica, oramai ci si e' abituati a ben altri standard, ed e' innegabile che anche l'occhio voglia la sua parte, questo pesa molto sul giudizio finale, mi fa storcere parecchio il naso, sa di play.
Riassumendo:  buona la parte fisica, il sistema di combattimento e l'audio, grafica pessima, l'intro a video da all'inizio un senso di trama, ma in gioco questa svanisce subito, ia dell'avversario verramente da tonti, in meno di 2 ore stanca. Bocciato. Non lo consiglio.
